title: Welcome To EPITA
content:
Welcome to EPITA!





We are thrilled that you have been accepted into our prestigious institution and we can't wait for you to join our community of learners.


As a new student, you will have access to a wide range of facilities and resources that will help you succeed in your academic journey. Our library is fully stocked with books and journals, and has a variety of study spaces to accommodate different learning styles. We also have state-of-the-art computer labs that are equipped with the latest software and technology to help you with your coursework.

In addition to our academic facilities, we also have a wide range of extracurricular activities and clubs that you can join. Whether you're interested in sports, music, or volunteering, there's something for everyone.


As a student at EPITA, you will be expected to take an active role in your education. This means attending classes, participating in discussions, and completing assignments on time. We also encourage you to seek out opportunities for research, internships, and study abroad programs that will help you develop your skills and interests.


We understand that the transition to university can be challenging, but we are here to support you every step of the way. You will have access to academic advisors and counselors who can help you with course selection, career planning, and any personal or academic issues you may be facing.

We are excited to have you as a member of EPITA community and look forward to supporting you in your academic and personal growth. Remember to take advantage of all the resources and opportunities that our university has to offer, and don't hesitate to reach out for help when you need it.


Best of luck in your studies!

title: EPITA facilities
content:
Discover the Amazing Facilities at EPITA

Welcome to EPITA, the premier institution for higher education! As a new student, you're about to embark on a thrilling journey filled with opportunities for growth, learning, and discovery. To help you get started, we want to introduce you to some of the fantastic facilities available to you here at EPITA.


State-of-the-Art Libraries


One of the key features of EPITA is our top-notch libraries. Our main library, located at the heart of campus, is a magnificent building that houses a vast collection of books, journals, and other resources. But that's not all – we also have several specialized libraries that cater to specific academic fields, including science, technology, and the humanities. With access to all these resources, you'll have everything you need to succeed academically.


Cutting-Edge Laboratories


Another exciting aspect of EPITA is our state-of-the-art laboratories. Whether you're studying science, engineering, or another technical field, you'll have the opportunity to work with cutting-edge equipment and technology. Our labs are equipped with the latest tools and resources, giving you hands-on experience with the concepts and techniques you'll need to succeed in your chosen career.


Sports and Fitness Centers


At EPITA, we believe that staying active and healthy is just as important as academic success. That's why we have a wide range of sports and fitness facilities available to all our students. Whether you prefer working out in the gym, playing a pickup game of basketball, or hitting the pool, you'll find plenty of opportunities to stay active and healthy here at EPITA.


Student Centers


Of course, studying and working hard is important, but we also know that you need time to relax and have fun. That's why we have several student centers on campus, including a game room, coffee shop, and movie theater. You'll have plenty of opportunities to unwind and socialize with other students, and you may even discover a new hobby or two!


Technology Hub


In today's fast-paced world, having access to technology is essential. That's why we've created a technology hub at EPITA, where you can access high-speed internet, print and scan documents, and use the latest software and hardware. Whether you need to finish a research paper or just catch up with friends online, our technology hub has you covered.

We hope you're as excited as we are about all the amazing facilities available to you here at EPITA. With so many opportunities for learning, growth, and discovery, you're sure to have an unforgettable experience during your time here. So go ahead and explore everything that our campus has to offer – you won't be disappointed!

title: Housing in Paris
content:
Finding a Place to Call Home: A Guide for New Students in Paris

Finding housing in Paris can be a daunting task, especially if you're a new student. However, with a little research and patience, you can find a great place to call home in the city of lights. Here are some tips to help you find housing in Paris:


Start Early

The first and most important tip for finding housing in Paris is to start early. The housing market in Paris is competitive, so the earlier you start looking, the better. Try to start your search at least a few months before your intended move-in date. This will give you enough time to compare different options, visit potential apartments, and make an informed decision.


Know Your Budget

Paris is known for its high cost of living, so it's essential to set a budget and stick to it. When calculating your housing expenses, be sure to factor in rent, utilities, and other fees. This will help you narrow down your search and avoid overspending.


Familiarize Yourself with the Neighborhoods

Paris is divided into many neighborhoods, each with its own character and charm. Before you start your search, take some time to research the different areas and find one that suits your lifestyle and budget. Consider factors such as proximity to your school, transportation, and local amenities.


Utilize Student Housing Services

Many universities in Paris offer student housing services that can help you find affordable and convenient housing. If your school has a housing office, be sure to reach out to them for assistance. They may have information on available student housing options and can provide guidance on the housing market in Paris.


Check Online Classifieds

Online classifieds, such as Leboncoin and SeLoger, are popular in France and can be a great resource for finding housing. Be sure to research the listings thoroughly, and if possible, reach out to the landlord or broker for more information. Remember to always be cautious of scams and only send money to trustworthy sources.


Ask for Recommendations

If you know anyone who has lived in Paris, ask them for recommendations on housing and neighborhoods. You can also reach out to your school or student organizations for advice on safe and affordable areas.


Visit in Person

If possible, visit Paris to check out potential apartments and neighborhoods. This will give you a better idea of the area and help you make a more informed decision. Try to schedule visits for when you'll be in the city, and be sure to bring a list of questions to ask the landlord or broker.


Get a Guarantor

Many landlords in Paris require a French guarantor for rental agreements. If you don't have a French national to act as your guarantor, consider using a third-party guarantee service. These services can provide a French resident to act as your guarantor, allowing you to secure a rental agreement and start your new life in Paris.


In conclusion, finding housing in Paris can be a challenging process, but with the right research, preparation, and patience, you'll be able to find a great place to call home. Remember to start early, know your budget, familiarize yourself with the neighborhoods, and utilize student housing services. Good luck and happy hunting!

title: Surviving in Paris
content:
How to survive in Paris!

Surviving in Paris as a foreign student can be challenging, but with the right tips and tricks, you can have a successful and memorable time in the city of lights. Here are some essential tips to help you thrive as a foreign student in Paris:

  1. Plan ahead: Before arriving in Paris, it's important to have a plan for housing, transportation, finances, and daily expenses. Research different options and make a budget to ensure you have enough money to cover your expenses.

  2. Learn the language: French is widely spoken in Paris, so it's essential to learn the basics to make your life easier. Take a French language course, practice speaking with locals, and immerse yourself in the language as much as possible.

  3. Get a student card: This card will provide you with discounts on transportation, museums, and cultural events. It also serves as an ID and is an excellent way to meet other students.

  4. Use public transportation: Paris has an extensive public transportation system, including buses, metro, and trains. Get a Navigo pass, a transportation card that provides you with unlimited access to all forms of public transportation in Paris.

  5. Make connections: Meet other students, attend student events, and join student organizations. You can also volunteer, take part in cultural activities, and attend local events to immerse yourself in the Parisian lifestyle and make new friends.

  6. Budget your expenses: Paris can be expensive, so it's important to budget your money wisely. Cook your meals instead of eating out, explore free events, and be mindful of your spending habits.

  7. Explore the city: Paris has a wealth of history, culture, and beauty to explore. Take advantage of your time in the city and visit its famous landmarks, museums, and neighborhoods.

Surviving in Paris as a foreign student takes some effort, but with these tips, you'll be able to thrive and enjoy your time in the city of lights. Good luck!
